title: Old letterpress font
content:
Today I used the letterpress machine at university. I am wondering what the font I used is called and weather it has ever been digitalised.

Hope you can help

Cheers

Rick Banks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [energy.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/typophile.com/files/energy.gif) | 467.4 KB |
author: rtgbanks

comments.content: Dont know why my face is so big!

you need to change your avatar size. 64x64 pixels at 72 dpi

:^)

It looks like some form of Helvetica Condensed. Does the 'G' have a spur on it?

- Lex
Nah, if this is letterpress this probably is a standard Grotesque or "Grot".

I suppose it would help if I read the thread title and the first post before replying :P

- Lex
Hehehe, happens to the best of us.

Rick, maybe take a look at these:

[Monotype Grotesque 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.126009.0.0) & [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=M.126012.0.0)  
 [Bureau Grotesque 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.613.0.0) & [2](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.6603.0.0)  
 [Grotesque No. 9](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=UR.115861.0.0)  
 [Gothic No. 13](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.120902.0.0)

Thanks alot Bald Condensed :-)

Already got Grotesque 9!

Cheers

Rick

There is a new (old) wood letter manufacturer in Hamburg, Germany.  
He offers not only these letters but although the possibility for designers to produce their own wood letters from their own compositions.

May be someone is interested in:  
 [http://www.holzlettern-manufaktur.de/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.holzlettern-manufaktur.de/ "http://www.holzlettern-manufaktur.de/")

And another new information about lead letters:  
The follow-up company of Stempel AG is still alive and will start new activities to offer their wonderful fonts worldwide. And they can deliver any height of letters which is needes, e.g.  
23,56 mm - German printing height  
23,32 mm - 0,918 Inches - anglo-amerikan height

If someone needs more information about this or that - please let me know.

Georg

Neuzeit-Grotesk halbfett, 20 p  
D.Stempel AG, Frankfurt am Main  
Erstguß 1928  
Entwurf Wilhelm Pischer

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1_6408.jpg)

Sorry, what does it mean "Wikkid… B^)"?

Georg
It means: "I enthusiastically approve, and demonstrate said approval by smiling widely and tilting my head in the idiosyncratic manner of George Clooney playing Batman."

Ehm.. yes..  
Thank you very much for your definition :-)

Georg

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Wikkid)'s some more information. I got it from watching too much [Ali G](http://web.archive.org/web/20130203114712/http:/www.disbealig.com/). _Booyakasha!_ :^)
